title: DaNNy001
author: DaNNy001
created_time: January 07, 2023, 06:43:24 PMLast edit: January 07, 2023, 11:26:49 PM by DaNNy001
content: Nigerians banks are all queuing in to stoping all transactions that has to deal with their naira cards and international transaction and just recently zenith bank has also joined this trend as i receive a mail that stated that from January 9 (Monday) all transactions that has to deal with the use of the zenith naira card in international transaction has been banned.This recent restructuring and restrictions in banks affair in the country will really have some effects for some users that purchase and order things online with their card from online international store like ~ali express ~amazon ~wish and so many more. It was just last year that banks limited the spending of naira debit cards in international transaction to 20$ and now this time they have suspended the whole process here so lets look into the reasons for all this restriction and how e go affect we Nigerians

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Dis Naija tire me no be small, na limit we dey see before but na suspension now. Dis their so-called suspension na till Naija get beta, make person no expect am again. I dey wonder why banks con dey loud am now self as sey d last time wey my GTB and Zenith bank naira ATM worked 4 international transactions na like 2020, I no know dis yeye suspension wey we dey see 4 news dis days. Na only few fit used theirs before.Emefiele and  Buhari don pafuka Naija, na d repercusion be dis. People go con dey get domiciliary account by force and even pay more to get and maintain dollar cards.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Dem won 2 implement and use di cashless economy policy nai make dem won stop the naira card transaction from zenith Bank. But day not withstanding, even dem stop dat won boys go use another way to buy things internationally. Nigeria economic department e no dey check things before dem dey implement things. Dem 4 check di both sides first, both di bad and good. But dem dey carry out anything without cross checking any. Let see how do cashless economy go be. Dem saw na on Monday which is on di 9th of January 2023.

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: Stopping naria ATM international transactions no get anything to do with cashless policy since na still online the business dey go on and nobody dey pay with cash na from your bank account them go debit you after payment. Na domitilary account na e them won go back to so, because I remember that year wey dollars scarce for naija,bank come say no more opening of domitilary account say them no get dollar to pay customers. Naija and their confusion. Our banking system and the people wey dey in charge just dey do anything wey come them head.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: This na very useless moves, the central bank of Nigeria are taking the wrong measures to see that the naira regains value. First was their attack on fiat exchange companies now this bans are very unnecessary.Well this is the best time to go for independent online banking application if you must do fiat. This isn’t a financial advice but I don see people say good things about the Chipper cash application.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: I didn't even know zenith bank Visa/Mastercard was still operational. Access bank been don stop international transactions with their cards for long. Some months ago I wanted to buy something from AliExpress and my Access visa card kept declining, so I had to reach out to my bank to find out why and I was told that they had stopped international transactions with cards and this was in compliance with CBN directives. I was told to apply for a dollar debit card but I had to decline because of the annual maintenance fees. I resorted for a virtual debit card from Chippercash, the exchange rate is the same as black market but I had to close my eyes and go through with it. I wish these online merchants like AliExpress, Amazon, eBay are accepting Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, it would have really saves one stress and cost.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on January 09, 2023, 07:33:14 AMThe reason is to discourage purchase of goods and services from foreign organizations, they are looking for ways naira will not depreciate more in value, but using it to inconvenient citizens. Your bank will support dollar card, and its daily limit is $1000, no limit for POS.Bro, Nigeria imports way more than it exports, and that is what is putting pressure on the naira and making it less valuable. Nigeria may export a huge amount of petroleum, gas, cocoa, beans, and gold, but it also exports a lot of other things, like cars, tires, and different kinds of food stuffs. I read in an article online that such activities were what led to a foreign trade deficit of N1.94 trillion in 2021 as the country imported far more than it exported, causing an imbalance that has made the naira weaker. This problem was mostly caused by some high-class businessmen and women and some government officials, but now it's people like you and me that are going to suffer more, while we don't even export anything too serious. Now that they (the government) have limited or canceled international transactions, I hope they have also made sure to limit those businessmen and other government officials that are playing more significant roles in the importing business because they are the ones who matter more while others who just buy a few things are going to suffer under these new rules.But Boss, do you think this rule, will affect those big business men and women who are really importanting more goods and way too much?
